ygData.subject: Re: A question on kill stealing.
ygData.msgSnippet: This seems like a common thing latley... I too have been heckeld about taking others loot when I did all the killing.. Sometimes people run and zone and
ygData.messageBody:
This seems like a common thing latley... I too have been heckeld about
taking others loot when I did all the killing.. Sometimes people run and
zone and because they started the battle think they should get the
rewards... But after you do all the work and kill it, do the most
damage yes you should get the rewards not the coward that fled and has
nothing better to do than complain about looseing a few silver.....

Sounds like a wimp with nothing better to do...

Nelix....Solsek Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: mark mark [SMTP:markerob@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 17, 1999 10:06 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] A question on kill stealing.
>
> From: "mark mark" <markerob@...>
>
> He sounds like an asshole,, there is more than enough there for
> everyone.
>
> Arathorne,,, Solsek Ro
>
> >From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>
> >Reply-To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> >To: Warrior2 List <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> >Subject: [warriors_eq] A question on kill stealing.
> >Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 09:48:39 -0400
> >
> >From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>
> >
> >Hi all,
> >I've been a roleplayer and a mudder for years now. I've come to EQ
> like
> >most of us, with a lot of experience in multiplayer gaming. Now, I'm
> >fairly new to EQ (level 8) but I thought I had a good understanding
> of
> >it, and it's unwritten rules, until now.
> >
> >The other night I was in BlackBurrow in a small group of 3. Two of us
> >were at the bottom level, and I was up top, returning from a town
> run. I
> >saw a gnoll guardsman kill someone, so I ran up to take charge of it.
> >There was nobody else around it. After a few hits it fled to the
> lower
> >level with me chasing it every step, hacking and kicking. Upon
> reaching
> >the lower level, there was a mini train already down there, but both
> me,
> >and the members of my group, were working on the gnoll guardsman I
> had
> >chased down. Towards the end of the fight, a fighter type of some
> sort
> >walked up and took the final swing on the guardsman. Thinking I had
> done
> >it ( I had to scroll back to look afterward) I bent over and looted
> the
> >corpse.
> >
> >The fighter started complaining at once that I was a kill stealer and
> I
> >took his loot. I explained to him that I had chased the monster down,
> >and had done the most damage, and therefore the computer LET me take
> my
> >kill. He respnded that HE had chased the monster down from the top (I
> >never even saw anyone up top but myself) and had made the kill
> therefore
> >it wasn't mine to take. I didn't feel like the argument was worth it
> so
> >I gave up and tried to trade him the loot. He would not accept, but
> >instead complained to me via tells that he couldn't believe I did
> that.
> >
> >My questions are:
> >1.) Was I ethically wrong to take the loot?
> >2.) Does the game only allow the majority damage dealer to take the
> >loot, or the final swinger?
> >3.) How would you guys deal with this situation?
> >
> >Thanks for any advice ....
> >-Faderic of Qeynos (Ellorisi Marr server)
> >
> >
> >
> >---------------------------------------------------------------------
